page.title: 13Reservoirs - Kennoway
page.content: Approximately 2km north-west of Kennoway are the{Carriston and Donald {Rose Reservoirs. Carriston was built in 1885 and has a catchment area of 1056 acres, a surface area of 24 acres and a capacity of 45 million gallons with a maximum depth of 6m. Donald Rose was built in 1929 and has a surface area of 19 acres and a capacity of 100 million gallons with a maximum depth of 16m. The Milldeans Burn feeds both reservoirs and can be diverted to feed either or by-pass them altogether. Constructed by the{Wemyss and {District Water Trust}to supply water to the Buckhaven and Methil areas, today they are kept in reserve following recent improvements in Regional water supplies. Both are maintained by{Fife Regional Council.
